acf.heading: Get an atorvastatin (Lipitor) prescription online.
acf.first_paragraph: Select your symptoms within the Maple app so the doctor can evaluate your symptoms and condition. Enter as much information as possible so that the doctor can make a thorough assessment.

accordion.accordion_title: What is atorvastatin and how does it work?
accordion.accordion_intro: Atorvastatin is part of a group of drugs called HMG CoA reductase inhibitors or “statins”. It works by reducing the amount of cholesterol made by your liver. Atorvastatin is sold under the brand name Lipitor.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the uses for atorvastatin?
accordion.accordion_intro: Atorvastatin is used to treat high cholesterol and to lower the risk of stroke, heart attack, or other heart complications in people with type 2 diabetes, coronary artery disease, or other risk factors. It is used to treat adults and children who are at least 10 years old. Atorvastatin works best when combined with eating a proper diet that’s low in fat and cholesterol, and making certain lifestyle changes, such as exercising, losing weight, and quitting smoking.

Atorvastatin is taken orally once a day with or without food, as directed by a doctor. Avoid eating grapefruit or drinking grapefruit juice while taking atorvastatin, as grapefruit can increase the level of the drug in your blood.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the side effects and risks of atorvastatin?
accordion.accordion_intro:
Common side effects of atorvastatin include:

  • Memory problems
  • Confusion
  • Mild muscle pain
  • Diarrhea
  • Mild nausea
accordion.accordion_content: If you experience more serious side effects, contact your doctor. This can include unexplained muscle pain or tenderness, fever, unusual tiredness, dark-coloured urine, reduced urine output, swelling, weight gain, increased thirst, dry mouth, fruity breath, increased diabetes symptoms, stomach pain, itching, clay-coloured stools, or jaundice.

accordion.accordion_intro: Do not take this medication if you are pregnant; stop taking atorvastatin immediately if you become pregnant. If you have liver disease, you should not take atorvastatin.
accordion.accordion_content: If you have any questions about the medication, you can speak to a doctor on Maple by registering for an account.
